post.author: Final_Light
post.body:
Do you think it's about time we put up a Doom 4 discussion room page, wev'e got a Rage and RTCW page, or is it to early ?

Also i vote BNA to create a Doom4World.org when it comes time.

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
I'm a busy man but I'll see what I can do!


...hehe good idea

post.author: Jack Rammsdell
post.body: I think it would be best to fit it under the name 6dworld like he planned awhile back, so he can keep all these games under one domain, instead of, doom3world, doom3world,quake4world, rageworld, and do on....

post.author: Kristus
post.body:
Most logical would be:
http://www.idtechworld.org

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Kristus wrote:
Most logical would be:
http://www.idtechworld.org


Actually it's this:

http://www.idtechworld.com/

A general note:

I have been too busy with real life to do as much here as I want to. This however does not mean I will abandon id software anytime soon, especially not with so many good looking technology in the pipeline.

There still is a project going on to create something like the "better 3D mapping (as a general substitute for user content creation) site" with features people will like and use frequently.
This requires me to do two weeks of thinking and two weeks of coding (don't get me started on design, it will use a somewhat simple, crappy and worksafe layout).

So many people have put so much valuable input here and I think this work should get featured more prominently in a better way.

I think most will be pretty much hyped the first time they see it. This will quickly vanish for solid frustration which will turn into valuable user feedback for me to process.

Don't hold your breath, but I really hope to be able to get down with it in the next 6 months (keep in mind - that's the 3rd time I said it).

post.author: Jack Rammsdell
post.body:
BNA's Signature wrote:
D3W - The world is yours, soon in 6 degrees of freedom!

your wedding ring says 6dof but your heart says idtechworld....

post.author: iceheart
post.body: I moved the forums around a bit in general (organized by engine), and also created a D4 forum.
